author: TNN
description: Bhupendra Devli, a 19-year-old long-distance runner, tragically died of a cardiac arrest while training for a marathon near Bhowali Road in Nainital. He collapsed while running with a friend and was rushed to the hospital, but was declared dead on arrival. Initial post-mortem reports suggest a massive cardiac arrest, possibly worsened by delayed medical intervention, was the cause of death.
title: 19-yr-old runner dies after cardiac arrest

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court declined to issue guidelines or penalties against a vigilante group threatening the release of 'Thug Life' in Karnataka, emphasizing the state's responsibility to prevent violence. Despite initial protests over Kamal Haasan's remarks, the film's producer expressed satisfaction with the state's assurance of maintaining order, leading to the dismissal of the petition.
title: No SC order on vigilantes, it says state to act against violent acts

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Chief Justice of India, B R Gavai, addressing Italian judges, highlighted the Supreme Court's role in promoting socio-economic justice over the past 75 years. He cited the SC's ban on "bulldozer justice," preventing arbitrary demolition of homes and upholding citizens' right to shelter.
title: SC put stop to 'bulldozer justice': Executive can't be judge, jury, says CJI

author: TNN
description: Amid escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, numerous Indian nationals, including students and pilgrims, are stranded, facing uncertain and risky returns. Indian embassies are coordinating evacuations, yet communication with some individuals remains difficult, causing immense distress to families back in India. Efforts are underway to provide assistance and facilitate their safe passage through neighboring countries.
title: Scores of Indians stranded in Iran, Israel; anxiety stalks kin

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Nasa has delayed the Axiom Mission 4 launch to the ISS, which includes Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, due to the need for further assessment of recent repairs on the Zvezda service module. Engineers are ensuring the space station is fully prepared to support the new crew, which also includes astronauts from Poland and Hungary.
title: Shubhanshu Shukla’s Axiom 4 launch delayed again; Nasa cites safety checks; new date expected soon

author: TNN
description: To enhance the airport lounge experience, operators and banks are planning direct business, bypassing aggregators. A dedicated app will allow flyers to book lounge access in advance and swipe their cards at the gate. This initiative aims to improve the lounge experience for premium credit cardholders and full-service airline passengers, addressing current issues like long queues and undifferentiated service.
title: Airport lounge experience set for a change

author: NAVJEEVAN GOPAL
description: A Canadian intelligence report acknowledges the presence of Khalistani extremists in Canada, using the country for promotion, fundraising, and planning violence in India. Tensions between Canada and India remain strained following the killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, with investigations suggesting Indian government links. The report also highlights concerns about India's foreign interference activities in Canada.
title: Canada intel: pro-Khalistan extremist using our soil as base to target India

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: An inquiry committee has rejected Justice Varma's explanations regarding the cash found at his residence, dismissing claims of planted evidence and arson. The panel's report highlighted Varma's control over the premises and questioned his conduct following the discovery. Evidence and witness statements suggest a breach of public trust, potentially leading to removal proceedings.
title: Cash-at-home case: Probe panel junks theories offered by Varma in his defence- Here's what report said

author: REBECCA SAMERVEL
description: A special NIA court has denied Gautam Navlakha's request to permanently reside in Delhi, citing jurisdictional constraints imposed by the Bombay High Court. Navlakha, an accused in the Elgar Parishad case, argued financial strain and his sister's health as reasons to relocate. The court emphasized that residing outside its jurisdiction differs from traveling beyond it, upholding the bail conditions.
title: Court rejects Navlakha's plea, says he can't permanently stay in Delhi

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has acknowledged the Tamil Nadu government's authority to suspend ADGP H M Jayaram, who is under investigation for an alleged kidnapping. The suspension aligns with All-India Service Rules, as clarified by senior advocate Siddharth Dave.
title: Day after rapping Tamil Nadu, SC says ADGP's suspension is in order

author: TNN
description: Over a decade after its enactment, the Lokpal, India's anti-corruption ombudsman, has established its prosecution wing. Mandated to investigate graft allegations against public officials, this move fulfills Section 12 of the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act, 2013.
title: A decade after Act was enacted, Lokpal notifies constitution of prosecution wing

author: DHANANJAY.MAHAPATRA
description: A high-level judicial panel's inquiry revealed a fire at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence on March 14 uncovered burnt, unexplained cash. Firefighters reported the blaze intensified due to alcohol from a liquor cabinet near the storeroom, where currency notes were visible amidst the debris. Justice Varma was away, and the room had to be forcibly opened, according to the report.
title: Cash-at-home case: Liquor fuelled fire at judge's house that burnt cash, says report

author: SAEED KHAN
description: The Gujarat High Court has issued a notice to the Bar Council of India (BCI) following a petition by Urvi Acharya, an LLM graduate, who failed the All India Bar Examination (AIBE) despite its open-book format. Acharya alleges a lack of transparency, as the BCI provided no justification for her failure, even after re-checking.
title: LLM degree holder fails bar test, HC sends notice to BCI

author: SANDEEP MOUDGAL
description: Following a tragic stampede during IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka government has drafted a bill to hold event organizers accountable for crowd management. The proposed legislation includes jail time and fines for safety violations, granting authorities broad powers to regulate events.
title: Post stampede, Karnataka drafts tough crowd-control bill

author: TNN
description: Shashi Tharoor, a Congress MP, has publicly acknowledged disagreements with certain party leaders, refraining from elaborating due to the Nilambur bypoll. This admission follows his praise for the NDA government's Operation Sindoor and participation in an all-party delegation against terror, reportedly causing discomfort within the Congress leadership.
title: Shashi Tharoor admits differences with party brass, but refuses to discuss them in public

author: TNN
description: Telangana Cyber Security Bureau's child protection unit apprehended fifteen repeat offenders involved in child sexual abuse material (CSEAM) activities. The accused, aged between 19 and 50, include an IIT-Kharagpur graduate earning Rs 35 lakh annually and an unemployed engineering graduate with a prior CSEAM case.
title: IIT graduate among 15 held for watching, circulating child porn

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: Mehul Choksi is suing the Indian government and five individuals in London's High Court, alleging his kidnapping from Antigua in 2021 was orchestrated by India's intelligence agency, R&AW, as part of a honeytrap plot to extradite him.
title: Mehul Choksi sues India in UK high court for ‘kidnapping him’ in Antigua

author: P NAVEEN
description: Madhya Pradesh High Court has ruled that WhatsApp chats are admissible as evidence in matrimonial disputes, even if obtained without consent. The court emphasized that while the right to privacy is fundamental, it is not absolute and can be reasonably restricted.
title: Privacy is a fundamental right but is subject to reasonable curbs: High Court

author: TNN
description: Indian Railways has initiated a policy shift by capping wait-listed tickets to a maximum of 25% of available berths in each class, aiming to reduce passenger uncertainty and overcrowding. This decision, implemented following a Railway Board circular, allows zonal railways to determine waitlist limits based on booking and cancellation patterns.
title: Railways caps wait-list tickets at 25% of train's capacity

author: SUNNY BASKI
description: Residents of Yamcha, a village near Nizamabad, Telangana, have bravely prevented over 300 suicide attempts in the past three years, primarily at the Basara bridge, a known suicide hotspot. The villagers, skilled swimmers, vigilantly monitor the river, especially during the monsoon, rescuing individuals driven to desperation by debt and family issues.
title: Telangana village on 'suicide watch' saves 300 lives in 3 years

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump will decide within two weeks whether the US will join Israel's military actions against Iran, amidst ongoing speculation. He acknowledged a 'substantial' chance for negotiations to peacefully resolve the conflict. This declaration offers a diplomatic window, despite Trump's earlier strong statements.
title: Will the US join Israel's strike on Iran? Here's what White House answered

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Alarmed by dangerously high arsenic levels in the Indus River, the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC) is launching a large-scale cleanup campaign. Recent tests revealed arsenic levels exceeding those in treated sewage. LAHDC Chairman Tashi Gyalson has directed the formation of flying squads to prevent garbage dumping and sewage discharge.
title: Arsenic, plastic in Indus: Ladakh launches army-civilian cleaning drive

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Amidst escalating conflict in Iran, Kashmiri medical students studying abroad faced harrowing journeys back home. Saba Rasool, a student at Urmia University, recounts the escalating tensions and the eventual evacuation facilitated by the MEA. While grateful for the support, students criticized the J&K administration's reception upon their return, highlighting inadequate transportation arrangements.
title: Kashmiri students relieved to be back home; praise MEA for swift evacuation from Iran

author: OMAR FAROOQ KHAN
description: A White House meeting between President Trump and Field Marshal Asim Munir has ignited speculation about a potential US-Pakistan realignment. Discussions centered on counter-terrorism, trade, and regional stability, with Trump reportedly seeking Pakistan's assistance regarding Iran in exchange for economic and military support. This move could reshape South Asia's power dynamics, impacting India's regional influence.
title: Trump-Munir meeting signals strategic calculations amid regional tensions

author: LUBNA KABLY
title: Visa interviews for international students set to open: US seeks social media details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the tragic Air India crash on June 12, 2025, that claimed approximately 270 lives, the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is leading the investigation. Both sets of the Dreamliner's black boxes, containing the Digital Flight Data Recorder (DFDR) and Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR), have been recovered.
title: Air India crash: Black box decoding location still undecided, says govt

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Come on, kill me!': Uddhav quotes Nana Patekar, calls Shinde rally a 'gathering of thieves'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravichandran Ashwin recounts the emotional rollercoaster surrounding his 500th Test wicket, achieved during the Rajkot Test against England. Amidst the celebrations, he had to rush back home due to his mother's illness, receiving immediate support from captain Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid. He rejoined the team later, showcasing his commitment to those who value him.
title: 'Didn't get a call from my family': Ashwin recalls emotional 500th wicket moment

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: The Nilambur byelection's outcome could significantly influence the strained relationship between Congress and Shashi Tharoor, which has been tense since his praise for PM Modi. Tharoor acknowledged differences with party leadership while affirming his loyalty to Congress values and workers. A Congress victory without Tharoor might worsen the divide, whereas a loss could strengthen his position within the party.
title: Ignored for campaign, Tharoor's message to Cong: 'Strong bond with ... '

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has intensified his criticism of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, accusing him of costing the U.S. billions by not cutting interest rates. Trump argues that the US should have lowered rates by 2.5 points, similar to Europe's actions, to save on debt.
title: Trump slams Jerome Powell, calling him one of the 'dumbest and most destructive'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mohammad Kaif supports Karun Nair's Test comeback, drawing parallels to Dravid, Laxman, and Pujara due to his red-ball temperament and consistency. Kaif also praises Sai Sudharsan's solid technique, envisioning him as a future Pujara or Dravid. For the fourth fast bowler slot, Kaif favors Nitish Reddy over Shardul Thakur, highlighting Reddy's batting prowess and recent red-ball performance.
title: IND vs ENG: 'He can bat all day like Dravid' - Ex-India cricketer lauds this batter

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, Russia cautioned the United States against military intervention, following Israeli strikes and Iranian retaliation. Despite a strategic partnership, Moscow hasn't offered military aid to Tehran, with Putin proposing mediation while condemning Israel. Putin and Xi Jinping jointly criticized Israel, advocating for a peaceful resolution.
title: Russia warns US against military action after Trump's 'may join' Israel remark

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Jodhpur police apprehended Daya Shankar, a wanted criminal, who attempted to evade capture by disguising himself as a woman. He was found wearing a saree, petticoat, and blouse. Social media was flooded with visuals of his arrest, showing him trying to conceal his face as police escorted him to the station, sparking varied reactions from online users.
title: Watch: Man in Jodhpur hides from police by dressing up as woman; arrested

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's deputy PM Ishaq Dar admitted India's strikes on Nur Khan and Shorkot airbases during Operation Sindoor, retaliating for the Pahalgam attack. Carried out on May 6 and 7, the operation prompted Pakistan to seek Saudi intervention to halt further Indian action. The strikes targeted terror camps and infrastructure, delivering a strong message in response to the Pahalgam massacre.
title: Watch: Pak deputy PM admits asking for ceasefire after India struck 2 airbases

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The Karen Read trial, a suburban tragedy turned national obsession, exposed the collision of American justice, media, and culture. Accused of murdering her boyfriend, a police officer, Read became a figure of intense public scrutiny, fueled by social media and dueling narratives. Ultimately acquitted, her case highlights the power of online opinion in shaping legal outcomes.
title: Why the Karen Read trial became America's true-crime obsession

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Bypolls across five Assembly segments in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala saw varied voter turnouts, with West Bengal's Kaliganj leading at nearly 70%. Largely peaceful, the polls were necessitated by MLA deaths and resignations. Key contests included those in Nilambur (Kerala), Visavadar and Kadi (Gujarat), and Ludhiana West (Punjab). The Election Commission implemented webcasting and mobile-phone deposit facilities.
title: 5 Assembly bypolls: High voter turnout in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
title: A two card trick: How Pakistan's crypto gambit and Nobel ploy turned Trump

author: SAURABH SINHA
title: AI suspends Amritsar-London, Goa-London flights till July 15; multiple routes affected

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Asteroid 2024 YR4, though not an Earth threat, now poses a collision risk to the Moon. Scientists estimate a 4.3% chance of impact, potentially ejecting 100 million kilograms of lunar debris into space. This debris could endanger satellites in low Earth orbit, crucial for communication, GPS, and climate monitoring, necessitating international attention and preparedness.
title: ‘City killer’ asteroid may hit the Moon in Dec 2032 could threaten satellites around Earth

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: C.J. Mosley, the former Baltimore Ravens standout and New York Jets defensive leader, has retired after a decade in the NFL. Drafted by Baltimore in 2014, Mosley earned four Pro Bowls before joining the Jets in 2019. Despite injuries, he anchored New York's defense, amassing over 1,000 tackles and showcasing exceptional leadership throughout his career.
title: Five-time Pro Bowl linebacker CJ Mosley retires from NFL

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: England's 'Bazball' approach faces its ultimate test in a five-Test series against India. While the aggressive strategy has brought success, vulnerabilities remain, including over-reliance on Joe Root, an inexperienced bowling attack post-Anderson and Broad, and a still-unsettled spin department. India's seasoned players and diverse attack will probe these weaknesses, questioning whether England can adapt when their high-risk philosophy is challenged.
title: IND vs ENG: Can Bazball outplay India's new era? Key battles and what to expect

author: TANUJ LAKHINA
description: Sachin Tendulkar, whose name now features on the England-India Test series trophy alongside Jimmy Anderson, shared insights on India’s inexperienced batting unit, the Bazball challenge, and the England seamer's legacy. He urged India to focus on winning sessions as the Test series begins at Headingley on June 20. The Master Blaster also reflected on cricket's evolution and explained what made Anderson special.
title: IND vs ENG: How to bat in England? Tendulkar shares tips for Indian batting

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Ahead of the first Test against England, Team India had an optional net session in Leeds. While key players like Pant and Bumrah skipped the session, Rahul, Jaiswal, and Gill had extensive practice. Karun Nair is likely to return to the Playing XI for the Headingley Test on Friday, June 20.
title: IND vs ENG: Playing XI cues from the nets - Karun Nair likely to play in Leeds

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Iran faces internal and external pressures. Israeli strikes eliminate key Iranian military figures. This exposes vulnerabilities. Khamenei's inner circle is weakened. Popular rage simmers. Khamenei's son consolidates power. Loyalty within the regime cracks. Military doctrine fails. The regime faces a historic crisis. It is a crisis of power and survival. The next week is crucial.
title: Israel pounds Iran: Ayatollah on the brink - will Khamenei’s regime implode?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Nuclear weapons, ballistic missiles: Israel's spy files reveal why it had to attack Iran

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Ahd ranks 3rd in bird strikes; animal rights group flags alarming spike post-deadly crash

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Bill Clinton on Middle East crisis: Netanyahu wants to stay in office forever

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former England skipper Alastair Cook observes that Virat Kohli and captain Rohit Sharma's Test retirements mark a significant shift in India's dressing room dynamics, creating a 'clean slate' for new leadership under Shubman Gill. Despite their recent form decline, Kohli and Sharma's absence removes unchallenged authority, potentially impacting team culture.
title: IND vs ENG: Cook's big statement on Virat-Rohit exit - 'Now there's a clean slate ...'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill, at 25, is set to captain India in Test cricket for the first time against England at Headingley. The article revisits the debut Test matches of previous Indian captains, highlighting their varied experiences. From Kohli's aggressive start with centuries to Ganguly's commanding win, each leader carved a unique path.
title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut – How past Indian skippers fared

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following the Indus Waters Treaty suspension, India is optimizing the Indus river system, looking to construct a 113-km canal to redirect water to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This inter-basin transfer aims to maximize water usage from eastern rivers and fully utilize India's share of western rivers, potentially limiting Pakistan's water access.
title: India bleeds Pak dry: Water at ‘dead’ levels; bigger Indus plans - top points

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: India launches hunt for partners to build futuristic jet; invites bids to build AMCA prototypes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a WNBA game, Sophie Cunningham defended Caitlin Clark after a foul. Cunningham's action led to her ejection and went viral. Fans praised her, and her jersey sales surged. Cunningham, known for her defense, became a fan favorite. The Fever won the game. Now, Cunningham is recognized as 'The Enforcer'. Everyone is watching her support for Clark.
title: Who is Sophie Cunningham? Viral WNBA moment shows her fierce defense of Caitlin Clark

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson affirmed that the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner involved in the June 12 crash was meticulously maintained. Enhanced pre-flight safety checks are now implemented across the 787 fleet, following a DGCA directive. Wilson stated that 26 of 33 aircraft have been cleared after inspections. A temporary reduction in widebody operations is a precautionary measure.
title: Ahmedabad tragedy: 'Aircraft, its engines showed no issues before flight,' says Air India CEO

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a historic move, the BCCI and ECB have announced the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy, replacing the Pataudi and Anthony De Mello Trophies, for Test series between India and England. This new title honours James Anderson and Sachin Tendulkar, celebrating their immense contributions to cricket.
title: Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy: India–England series enters new era, tribute to legends

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) released a video claiming Iran was using the Arak nuclear reactor to develop nuclear weapons, stating it neutralized the reactor in a recent attack. Iranian state TV confirmed the attack, noting the site was evacuated beforehand, posing no radiation threat. This action retaliated against Iran's strike on an Israeli hospital.
title: 'Created to build nukes': IDF gives closer look at nuclear reactor in Iran- watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Now, in 2025, Trumpworld believes a single strike on Fordo — Iran’s heavily fortified nuclear site — will miraculously solve the nuclear crisis. Supporters like John Bolton urge, “Bomb Fordo and be done with it,” echoing the casual fatalism of Iraq’s early architects. Tulsi Gabbard, now Director of National Intelligence, has said Iran isn't actively building a bomb. Trump’s response? “I don’t care what she said.”
title: Deja vu diplomacy: Why Trump's Iran gamble feels like Bush's worst mistake

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: Delhi has improved its Performance Grading Index (PGI) score by 44 points, moving from Akanshi-1 to Prachesta-3 in the 2023–24 evaluation released by the Ministry of Education. The capital made notable gains in infrastructure and governance, while maintaining strong performance in equity. However, learning outcomes and access showed limited improvement. Delhi’s progress reflects broader national trends, with 24 states and UTs improving their PGI scores, though only Chandigarh reached the Prachesta-1 grade.
title: Delhi schools rise in rankings: 44-point jump in PGI 2.0; What drove the big score boost?

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Shubman Gill, the new Test captain, expressed his honour at leading India and confirmed he would bat at No.4, filling Virat Kohli's spot. He emphasized creating a secure team environment and backing young players. While keeping the playing XI flexible based on pitch conditions, Gill hinted at an evolving team identity to be revealed later in the series.
title: IND vs ENG: Gill plays cards close to his chest on India XI; reveals speaking to Rohit, Virat

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: India has initiated a comprehensive review of its Defence Acquisition Procedure 2020 to expedite weapon system procurement, promote self-reliance, and increase private sector involvement. The review aims to streamline processes, align with 'Atmanirbharta' goals, and encourage indigenous technology infusion.
title: India kicks off much-needed review of arms procurement procedures

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: ‘It's a privilege, not a right’: US embassy warns visa holders after viral deportation video

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following a tragic stampede in Bengaluru that claimed 11 lives, the Karnataka government is planning to introduce a bill focused on crowd control and management. Other proposed legislation includes the Rohith Vemula Bill, aimed at preventing caste-based discrimination, along with measures to combat misinformation, fake news, hate speech, and hate crimes.
title: Karnataka mulls bill on crowd control post Bengaluru stampede

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Mumbai airport customs seized hydroponic weed worth approximately Rs 25 crore. Officials arrested three individuals. Coimbatore airport officials previously seized 5.25kg of hydroponic weed worth Rs 5 crore. A Kerala native was arrested for smuggling from Bangkok. Hydroponic ganja has a high THC content, making it potent. NCB notes its limited prevalence compared to synthetic drugs.
title: Mumbai: Rs 25 crore worth of hydroponic weed seized at airport; 3 arrested

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: New rules for US student visa: Social media profiles must be 'public'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have strongly condemned Israeli strikes on Iran, urging de-escalation through diplomacy. They emphasized that halting hostilities is the top priority, as the conflict intensifies with attacks on both sides, including a missile strike on an Israeli hospital and retaliatory strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. The situation threatens to escalate into a broader regional war.
title: On call, Putin, Xi term West Asia 'top priority'; condemn Israeli strikes

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A high court judge, Yashwant Varma, faces potential impeachment after an inquiry found him and his family had control over a store room where burnt cash was discovered. The inquiry committee, led by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu, found serious misconduct, leading to a recommendation for Justice Varma's removal by former CJI Sanjiv Khanna.
title: SC panel proposes impeachment of Justice Varma - What probe report said

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: In Patna, just a day before Prime Minister Modi's visit to Bihar, gunfire erupted in a high-security zone near the residences of top officials, including the Chief Minister and Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav. Two assailants on a motorcycle opened fire, prompting a police investigation and raising concerns about security.
title: Shots fired near Tejashwi Yadav’s house in Patna

author: LUBNA KABLY
description: In a landmark decision, a US federal court has blocked the State Department from enforcing a policy that restricted passport gender markers to birth-assigned sex. Judge Julia E. Kobick's ruling extends to individuals not identifying with their birth gender, allowing them to obtain passports reflecting their gender identity.
title: US judge blocks Trump administration's ‘Passport Gender Policy’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amidst the escalating Iran-Israel crisis, the Indian government has decided to evacuate Indian nationals from Israel who wish to return. Travel will be facilitated via land borders and then by air to India. Registration details and contact information for the Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv have been provided for assistance.
title: 'Will evacuate Indians who wish to leave Israel,' says MEA- check details

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Karen Read was acquitted of murder and manslaughter in the death of her boyfriend, Boston police officer John O'Keefe, but found guilty of OUI. The verdict, delivered after a retrial, sparked contrasting reactions, with Read's supporters celebrating and O'Keefe's family decrying a miscarriage of justice.
title: Who is Karen Read? Boston woman acquitted of murdering cop boyfriend in 2022

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Even modest weight gain, not just obesity, can strain the kidneys, leading to hyperfiltration and potential damage. Kidneys don’t complain. They don’t show fatigue, or ache, or make noise. That’s why even small signals—like a few extra kilos—need attention. In today’s world, where lifestyle diseases often begin quietly, guarding kidney health becomes more about awareness than alarm.
title: Can gaining even 3-4 kgs of weight increase risk of kidney disease? How to prevent it

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel issued a stark warning to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. They said he cannot continue to exist. This followed Iranian retaliatory strikes, including an attack on an Israeli hospital. The conflict has escalated with attacks on nuclear facilities. Casualties are mounting on both sides. The US has stated it has no plans to target Khamenei for now.
title: Mid East crisis: Khamenei 'can no longer be allowed to exist,' warns Israel

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: England captain Ben Stokes acknowledges the absence of key Indian players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for the upcoming Test series but warns against underestimating India's new squad under Shubman Gill. Stokes praises Jasprit Bumrah and welcomes Chris Woakes' return, highlighting England's strong record with him.
title: Stokes on India Tests: 'No Virat, Rohit or Ashwin, but that doesn't make it easier'

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: NASA reports sunspot region 4114 unleashed 2025's most powerful X1.2-class solar flare on June 17, causing widespread shortwave radio blackouts, especially over the Pacific, including Hawaii. Frequencies below 25 MHz were disrupted, affecting aviators and ham radio operators. Although no coronal mass ejection accompanied it, the flare's intensity disturbed Earth's ionosphere.
title: Sun emits year's strongest solar flare, triggers radio blackouts: Nasa

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Travis Kelce shared a glimpse into his relationship with Taylor Swift, revealing they have a shared movie list, including 'Pretty Woman.' This detail highlights their low-key moments amidst fame. Kelce's past movie experiences, like watching 'American Pie,' also connect to Swift's song lyrics, showcasing their grounded connection.
title: Travis Kelce shares cozy home moments with Taylor Swift

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran expressed grief over the Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, which resulted in over 270 fatalities. He announced the creation of an "AI-171 Trust" to provide long-term support to affected families. Investigations into the cause of the crash are underway, with preliminary findings expected in a month, while Air India is cooperating fully with authorities.
title: Air India crash: Chandra says 787 had ‘new engine’, ‘clean history’ & ‘no red flags’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has acknowledged his differences with the party's leadership, revealing he wasn't invited to campaign in the Nilambur Assembly byelection. Tharoor emphasized resolving issues internally and reaffirmed his commitment to the party's values and workers.
title: 'Have disagreements with some in Congress leadership,' admits Shashi Tharoor

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Gary Kirsten expresses confidence in Shubman Gill's leadership abilities as he embarks on his first full Test captaincy assignment against England. Kirsten highlights Gill's intelligence, dedication, and exemplary training habits as key factors for success. Matthew Hayden acknowledges Gill's potential while noting his limited Test experience in England.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Primed to take ...' - Kirsten's bold prediction about captain Gill

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: JioStar's broadcast of IPL 2025 reached over a billion viewers, amassing 840 billion minutes of watch-time. The RCB vs PBKS final became the most-watched T20 match ever, with 31.7 billion minutes consumed. Digital consumption surged by 29%, while linear TV also achieved record-breaking viewership, marking a monumental success for the tournament.
title: IPL 2025 breaks viewership records as final becomes most-watched T20 match ever, BARC data reveals

author: HIJAM RAJU SINGH
description: Matthew Mott, now coaching Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket, shares his vision for growing cricket in the US. He emphasises building a team-first culture, nurturing local talent alongside international stars, and providing better infrastructure for player development. Mott believes MLC can inspire young Americans and create a sustainable cricket ecosystem, ultimately feeding into the national team.
title: MLC: 'Cricket in USA is a sleeping giant' - Mott eyes long-term success with Seattle

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India and the UK finalized their Free Trade Agreement (FTA) during an informal meeting in London's Hyde Park, where Minister Piyush Goyal and his UK counterpart, Jonathan Reynolds, sealed the deal over ice cream.
title: Sealed over ice cream & walk! How India-UK trade deal was finalised, Piyush Goyal reveals

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has delayed the release of the city intimation slip for the UGC NET June 2025 exam, originally expected by June 16. With exams starting on June 25, candidates remain uncertain about their exam centre locations. The admit card will follow soon after the city slip. Aspirants are advised to regularly check the official website, ugcnet.nta.ac.in, for updates and prepare accordingly for the examination.
title: UGC NET June 2025: City intimation slip delayed, check ugcnet.nta.ac.in for updates

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Every time the world inches closer to nuclear war, a question echoes across newsroom Slack threads, Reddit conspiracies, and cable news chyron typos: Who the hell is Jeff?
title: Who is 'Jeff'? And why does 'he' have 10 nuclear weapons?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Aman Gupta, Boat co-founder and Shark Tank India judge, admitted to missing significant moments in his daughters' lives due to his entrepreneurial pursuits. He stated that these sacrifices were essential for his success and expressed no regrets. Gupta acknowledged the cost of his achievements, emphasizing the hard work required to reach his current position.
title: Boat CEO Aman Gupta says he missed moments with daughter; has no regrets because…

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: From Bodhi Tree to Warli: What PM Modi gifted to world leaders during his 3-nation tour

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Shashi Tharoor criticized Donald Trump's lunch with Asim Munir. He reminded the US of Pakistan's history with terrorism. Tharoor cited Osama bin Laden's presence near a Pakistani army camp. He hoped the US raised concerns about Pakistan's support for terrorism. Trump invited Narendra Modi to the US, but Modi declined.
title: 'Hope the food was good': Tharoor's jab on Trump's lunch with Pakistan's Munir

author: PRANAV SHUKLA
description: England's Test pitches have transformed over the past five years. Once known for seam and swing, they now offer flatter decks, higher scoring, and more results. Run rates are up, draws are down, and Bazball has redefined tempo. With fewer grind-fests and more fourth-innings drama, Test cricket in England feels faster, fresher, and far more entertaining.
title: IND vs ENG: How England’s Test pitches have become batting-friendly yet result-oriented

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill captains a new-look Indian team in England, aiming to end an 18-year Test series drought, stepping in after Kohli and Sharma's retirements. Gill also replaces Kohli at No. 4, facing pressure to perform despite a modest Test record in England. There are question marks elsewhere - such as for the No. 3 spot and on the bowling lineup.
title: IND vs ENG: Projected India XI for first Test; series begins on June 20

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Neeraj Chopra will compete at the Paris Diamond League 2025 without facing his Pakistani rival Arshad Nadeem. Chopra returns to the French capital after eight years, aiming for victory after recent second-place finishes. The event boasts a star-studded lineup including Julian Weber and Anderson Peters. Following Paris, Chopra will participate in Ostrava's Golden Spike meet and his hosted Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru.
title: Paris DL: Will Neeraj Chopra be up against Pakistan's Nadeem? All you need to know

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru faced a security scare. An email threatened bombs on the premises. Authorities conducted extensive checks following the threat. No explosives were discovered, and the threat was declared a hoax. Police have started an investigation to find the email's sender. Airport operations were not significantly disrupted during the security procedures. The case has been registered.
title: 'Plan B' if 'Plan A' fails: Bengaluru airport gets bomb threat

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's funeral will be held in New Delhi on Thursday, with ex-wife Karisma Kapoor and their children, Samaira and Kiaan, attending. They were seen at the Mumbai airport, accompanied by Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan, heading to the ceremony.
title: Sunjay Kapur funeral: Karisma Kapoor accompanies kids for their father's last rites

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Divya Deshmukh, an 18-year-old Indian chess prodigy, has gained global recognition after defeating World No. 1 Hou Yifan at the World Blitz Team Chess Championship in London. Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded her victory, highlighting her determination and inspiration to aspiring chess players. Divya's success, along with her other achievements, underscores India's growing prominence in international chess.
title: Who is Divya? Indian star congratulated by PM Modi after win over world no. 1 Yifan

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: nfosys founder NR Narayana Murthy dismisses AI job elimination fears, arguing technology creates new employment opportunities. Citing banking sector's 40-50x job growth post-computerization, he believes AI will enhance productivity and enable programmers to solve complex problems, transforming rather than replacing the workforce in India's IT industry.
title: Will AI take IT jobs in India? Narayana Murthy opens up: What will happen in the future is our programmers will …

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court has directed the Karnataka government to ensure the smooth screening of Kamal Haasan's film "Thug Life," taking action against those obstructing its release. The court expressed concern over the suppression of artistic expression due to perceived offense, emphasizing the state's duty to protect freedom of expression.
title: 'You succumbed to pressure': SC raps Karnataka govt over threat to 'Thug Life' release

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: During a White House visit, Juventus players and staff faced an awkward situation when Donald Trump steered their ceremonial event into a political discussion. He questioned the team about transgender athletes in women's sports, following a Supreme Court ruling on gender-affirming care. Trump's focus on this issue aligns with his second-term agenda, including policies restricting transgender participation in women's sports.
title: Trump questions Juventus on women in men’s team; players exchange awkward glances

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: The murder of businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya takes a twist with the emergence of 'Sanjay Verma,' a possible alias used by Sonam Raghuvanshi's alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. Police are investigating a potential financial motive linked to a major contract Raja secured. Reenactment of the crime revealed a second weapon and Sonam's presence during the attack.
title: Mystery deepens in Raja’s murder; Sanjay Verma under scanner, cops probe 200+ calls with Sonam

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: From July 1, obtaining a new PAN card will require mandatory Aadhaar authentication, according to the Central Board of Direct Taxes. This initiative aims to enhance accountability and compliance in tax filing through digitalization. While existing PAN holders have until December 31, 2025, to link their Aadhaar without penalty, failure to do so will render their PAN inoperative next year.
title: Applying for PAN Card? Aadhaar to be mandatory; new rule likely from July 1

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: KL Rahul acknowledges the absence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the upcoming Test series against England, highlighting the opportunity for younger players to step up. He praised Karun Nair's comeback after eight years, recognizing his resilience and recent form.
title: IND vs ENG: 'No Virat, no Rohit —It feels strange'; KL Rahul on a new era in Indian cricket

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant eyes MS Dhoni's record as Pant seeks to become India's top wicketkeeper-batter. He needs one more century to surpass Dhoni's Test record. The upcoming England series is crucial for Pant. Dhruv Jurel's performance adds pressure. Pant aims to improve after a below-par showing in Australia. All eyes are on Pant's performance in the upcoming matches.
title: IND vs ENG: Pant eyes Dhoni's massive record; Leeds Test to start on June 20

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Microsoft plans to cut thousands of jobs in July, primarily targeting its 45,000-person sales division. This marks the third major layoff round this year following 6,000 May cuts. The company is restructuring while investing $80 billion in AI infrastructure. CEO Satya Nadella calls it "realignment" for AI transformation, not performance issues.
title: Microsoft plans fresh layoffs this year: 1000+ employees to be cut, & these roles are likely to be affected

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In the wake of Operation Sindhu, Indian students returning from Iran shared their chilling accounts of survival amidst missile strikes and destruction. One student vividly recalled the sight of missiles raining down, leaving Tehran in devastation. The Indian government stepped in, offering comprehensive support for their safe return, including personalized assistance.
title: 'Saw missile fall from sky': Evacuated Indian students share Iran ordeal

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Amit Shah advocates for prioritizing native languages over foreign ones. He envisions a future where Indians embrace their linguistic heritage. Shah links this to PM Modi's 'Panch Pran' for India's development by 2047. He also calls for reforms in administrative officer training. Shah emphasizes the importance of literature in preserving Indian culture.
title: 'Those who speak English will soon feel ashamed': Amit Shah

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: The Karnataka State IT/ITeS Employees Union (KITU) is urging workers to oppose the Karnataka government's proposal to extend daily working hours in the IT, ITeS, and BPO sectors to 12 hours. Trade unions have voiced strong opposition, citing concerns about work-life balance, job security, and potential mental health impacts, viewing the move as prioritizing corporate profits over employee welfare.
title: 'Turning humans into machines': 12-hour shifts for Bengaluru techies?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Trump approves Iran strike plans but no final order yet; what's the attack plan?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India will send the severely damaged black box from the Air India Boeing 787 crash to the United States for detailed analysis. Data extraction in India has proven unfeasible due to extensive fire damage. The National Safety Transport Board in Washington will examine the Digital Flight Data Recorder.
title: Air India plane crash: Black box of 787 Dreamliner to be sent to US for data recovery

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Michael Vaughan lauded Jasprit Bumrah as the greatest bowler he has ever witnessed, anticipating a renewed challenge for Joe Root in the forthcoming India vs England Test series. Bumrah has dismissed Root nine times in Test cricket, establishing a compelling rivalry.
title: IND vs ENG: Vaughan believes Bumrah could have Root’s number again

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amazon is forcing thousands of corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle, Arlington, and Washington DC. Employees receive 30 days to decide and 60 days to relocate or resign without severance. The mandate coincides with CEO Andy Jassy's warning that AI will shrink Amazon's workforce, potentially prompting voluntary departures as a cost-cutting measure.
title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: An IndiGo flight 6E 2006, en route from Delhi to Leh, was compelled to return to Delhi's IGI Airport on Thursday morning due to a technical malfunction that imposed operational landing restrictions in Leh. The Airbus A320-251N aircraft, carrying passengers, safely returned, and an alternative aircraft was arranged to minimize travel disruptions. The aircraft is currently undergoing maintenance.
title: Delhi-Leh IndiGo flight returns after takeoff due to technical snag

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A dramatic escalation in tensions has occurred as an Iranian missile has struck the Soroka Hospital in southern Israel, inflicting serious damage. Emergency services are on the scene assessing the casualties, and residents are strongly advised to avoid the area.
title: Footage shows moment Iranian missile struck Israel's main hospital in south

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold is testing a crucial support zone around ₹98,700, presenting a buying opportunity with a target of ₹1,01,000 and a stop-loss below ₹98,000. Silver has surpassed ₹109,000, indicating a bullish trend supported by a completed pattern, targeting ₹111,900 with a stop-loss at ₹107,500, influenced by geopolitical tensions.
title: Gold & silver price prediction : What's gold rate outlook for June 19- should you purchase

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'May he be blessed with long life': PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Rahul

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: SpaceX Starship prototype faced a major issue during a test at Starbase, Texas. The incident occurred late Wednesday night. All personnel are safe. The team is working with local officials to secure the site. There are no hazards to nearby communities. The company has asked people not to approach the area.
title: Watch: SpaceX test ends in blast at Texas site; all personnel safe

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mark Walter is set to become the new majority owner of the Los Angeles Lakers. The Buss family is selling the NBA franchise for $10 billion. Walter already owns stakes in several sports teams. He has a successful track record with the Los Angeles Dodgers. Walter's purchase brings stability and a winning blueprint to the Lakers.
title: Who Is Mark Walter? Man behind Lakers’ $10 B takeover- all you need to know about him

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Why Pak never helped 'brother' Iran develop nuclear weapons

author: TNN
description: Two Air India flight attendants claim they were terminated after refusing to alter their statements regarding a Boeing 787 door malfunction in May 2024. They allege the door, opened in manual mode, deployed a slide raft, a situation initially corroborated by the pilot.
title: 'Told to change statement, then fired': Ex-AI staffers' serious charge

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Magnus Carlsen's fist smash at Norway Chess, following a loss to Gukesh, sparked widespread attention, overshadowing their game. Caruana shared insights on Carlsen's motivation against Gukesh, emphasising the significance of defeating the world champion. Caruana also acknowledged Gukesh's strong performances over the past year and his own expectations to compete with the rising Indian chess talents.
title: Chess: Why was Carlsen upset after loss to Gukesh? Caruana explains

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's Test squad sees a late change as Harshit Rana joins the team for the England series, following his India-A performance. This decision has sparked debate, especially after Mukesh Kumar's cryptic social media post and criticism from Dodda Ganesh, who suggested Anshul Kamboj's inclusion.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Karma is unforgiving' - Mukesh shares cryptic post after Harshit gets India call-up

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Op Sindoor pause: After PM sets record straight, Trump takes U-turn

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: The QS World University Rankings 2026 names MIT as the top global university, with Imperial College London in second place. The rankings highlight a growing academic influence in Asia, featuring 565 ranked universities. Notable shifts include IIT Delhi becoming India’s highest-ranked institution and McGill leading in Canada. Over 1,500 universities across 106 countries were evaluated, with the U.S. and UK dominating the top 10. The data signals an increasingly competitive, globalised academic landscape.
title: QS World University rankings: MIT retains top spot; see how Indian universities fared

author: TNN
description: Skeletal remains were unexpectedly unearthed during a routine cleaning of percolation pits at a Bengaluru apartment complex, unsettling residents and prompting a police investigation. The discovery, which included suspected skull fragments, occurred in Industrial Layout, Begur, on June 16.
title: Spooky discovery: Bones, skulls found at Bengaluru apartment complex

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday following global cues. While Nifty50 was near 24,800, BSE Sensex was below 81,450.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,800; BSE Sensex opens in red

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's funeral will be held in New Delhi today, June 19, with final rites at 5 PM at Lodhi Road Cremation Ground. A prayer meet is scheduled for June 22 at the Taj Palace Hotel. Kapur, 53, passed away on June 12 in London, reportedly from a heart attack.
title: Sunjay Kapur funeral: Businessman's last rites to be held in Delhi today

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the Air India crash in Ahmedabad, the civil aviation ministry has released draft rules targeting structures posing risks to aircraft. These rules empower authorities to act against buildings and trees exceeding height limits near aerodromes. Owners of non-compliant structures face notices, potential demolition, and can appeal orders, but compensation is limited to those who comply with initial directives.
title: AI crash: Govt tightens aircraft safety rules; structures violating height limit under lens

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: WV Raman draws parallels between the young Indian squad led by Shubman Gill and the 2007 T20 World Cup-winning team, highlighting the advantage of low expectations. The former India cricketer also emphasises on the importance of support for the new captain, Shubman Gill, and strategic role allocation within the team.
title: EXCLUSIVE | 'Gill-led India in same situation as MS Dhoni's T20 WC team': WV Raman

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid escalating conflict, Israel continues strikes in Iran, prompting US consideration of military action. US President Trump hints at potential US involvement and reveals Iran's interest in talks. Russia offers mediation. India, under Operation Sindhu, evacuates 110 Indian nationals from Iran. Casualties in Iran rise to 639, according to Human Rights Activists, while Supreme Leader Khamenei vows no surrender.
title: Israel issues new evacuation warning in Iran; is a US strike on cards? 10 key developments

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Khalistanis using Canada as base': Ottawa's big submission; confirms India's stance

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Aamir Khan's recent attempt to recreate Magnus Carlsen's viral outburst after losing to D Gukesh has sparked mixed reactions online. In a reel with influencer Prakhar Gupta, Khan mimics Carlsen's table-slam, poking fun at his own 'Mr. Perfectionist' image. While some appreciated the self-deprecating humor, many criticized the performance, labeling it as 'overacting.
title: ‘Kyu nahi ho rahi acting?’: Aamir trolled for mimicking Carlsen’s Norway Chess viral outburst – Watch

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends Kaynes, Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL), and Gland Pharma as top stock picks for today. Nifty is expected to consolidate between 24650 and 25050, while Bank Nifty ranges from 55400 to 56200.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for June 19, 2025 - check list

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Two Indian students in the US have been sentenced to federal prison for separate fraud schemes targeting elderly Americans. Kishan Rajeshkumar Patel received over 5 years for defrauding victims of nearly $2.7 million by impersonating government officials. Moinuddin Mohammed was sentenced to eight years for a similar scam resulting in $6 million in losses.
title: Two Indian nationals jailed in US for phishing scam targeting elderly

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Anaya Bangar, child of former Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar, is advocating for transgender cricketers' inclusion in women's cricket. Anaya has urged the ICC and BCCI to reconsider the current ban. Anaya is submitting an eight-page scientific report detailing her transition and physiological assessments after hormone therapy, demonstrating alignment with cisgender female athlete norms.
title: 'Women's cricket ke liye eligible hoon': Anaya Bangar urges ICC, BCCI to include transgenders

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Walking, a simple yet effective exercise, offers numerous physical and mental benefits. Aiming for 30 minutes of brisk walking daily aligns with health guidelines, reducing risks of heart disease and improving mood.
title: 30 or 45 minutes: Which is the ideal time for a daily walk

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A simple 'Sitting-Rising Test' (SRT), involving sitting and standing without support, can indicate cardiovascular health and longevity, says scientists. A study in the European Journal of Preventive Cardiology found that individuals with low SRT scores faced a significantly higher risk of mortality from heart issues. The test assesses strength, balance, and flexibility, reflecting overall functional fitness.
title: Heart health: Not yoga, not a workout—but most people fail this simple heart test

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cricket fans are excited for the India versus England Test series. Former players are picking their dream teams. Nasser Hussain left out Rohit Sharma. He thinks England will win 3-1. Graeme Swann predicts a 4-1 victory for England. Key Indian players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma may not play. Shubman Gill will lead India. Ben Stokes captains England.
title: 'Kohli yes, but not Rohit ' - Ex-England skipper picks combined post-2000 Test XI

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The Trump administration has resumed student visa interviews, requiring applicants to make their social media accounts public for review. Refusal to do so could lead to visa rejection, as officials will scrutinize posts for hostility towards the U.S. This decision comes after a temporary halt and aims to thoroughly vet applicants before the start of the academic year.
title: Tougher rules for foreign students; Trump team enforces social media checks

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid rising tensions between Iran and Israel, a US E-4B Nightwatch doomsday plane made a rare flight to Joint Base Andrews. This mobile command post, designed for nuclear conflict or national emergencies, took an unusual route and used a different callsign, sparking speculation.
title: US 'doomsday plane' flies to Washington; what it means

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US Vice President JD Vance faced a brief suspension from Bluesky soon after his first post. Bluesky stated that the account was flagged as a fake due to impersonation attempts. The account was restored within 20 minutes with a verification badge. Vance shared his views on a Supreme Court ruling and transgender medical treatments.
title: Vance banned from liberal social media Bluesky; platform blames error; account restored

author: TNN
description: At the G7 outreach session, PM Modi strongly condemned terrorism, citing the Pahalgam attack as an assault on humanity. He criticized double standards in combating terror, noting India's neighborhood as a breeding ground. Modi questioned the international community's seriousness in addressing terrorism and highlighted the impact of global conflicts on the Global South.
title: G7 Summit: PM Narendra Modi slams double standards on terror

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: The Indian government is set to mandate Indian Standard Time (IST) for all official activities, aiming to eliminate reliance on foreign systems like GPS. This move, driven by cybersecurity concerns and past incidents, involves an indigenous timekeeping system developed by NPL and ISRO. The initiative promises enhanced security for digital transactions, accurate billing, and reduced cybercrime risks through synchronized timekeeping.
title: IST to be mandatory time reference, govt asks banks, Sebi to discontinue using other systems

author: TNN
description: Amidst ongoing political sparring, Congress criticizes the government over Pakistan's army chief's meeting with Trump, labeling it a diplomatic setback. BJP retaliates, asserting Modi's conversation with Trump on Operation Sindoor refuted Congress's claims of mediation. The party insists India firmly rejects third-party intervention, accusing Congress of spreading misinformation to undermine India's foreign policy.
title: PM busted Congress lies; Cong claims Trump-Munir meet 'jhatka' to diplomacy

author: TNN & Agencies
description: PM Modi's visit to Zagreb marked the first by an Indian PM, leading to discussions with Croatian counterpart Andrej Plenkovic. Both leaders emphasized dialogue and diplomacy over conflict, particularly amid escalating global tensions.
title: PM in Croatia: No solutions from battlefields; leaders agree to boost def ties

author: TNN
description: At the G7 Summit in Canada, PM Narendra Modi and Italian PM Giorgia Meloni displayed a strong rapport, exchanging warm greetings and compliments. Meloni praised Modi, acknowledging their friendship. Both leaders affirmed the strengthening ties between Italy and India, highlighting their camaraderie at various global events like COP in Dubai and G20 summits.
title: 'You're the best': Italian PM Meloni tells PM Modi in Canada

author: KANGKAN KALITA
description: Air India flight attendant Lamnunthem Singson, a Kuki woman, will be buried in Kangpokpi, Manipur, her body rerouted via Dimapur due to ethnic tensions. Imphal was avoided despite being closer. Meanwhile, Kongbrailatpam Nganth8oi Sharma, a Meitei colleague, remains unidentified, her sister awaiting DNA confirmation in Ahmedabad. The Meitei Heritage Society has condemned attempts to politicize the tragic plane crash.
title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Body of Kuki flight attendant from Manipur to land in Nagaland

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Assembly bypolls across Gujarat, Kerala, West Bengal, and Punjab are being closely watched as the first electoral test post the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. These elections are particularly significant in Kerala and West Bengal, where assembly elections are due early next year.
title: Assembly bypolls: Elections in Bengal, Kerala, Punjab, Gujarat today

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: The government is set to launch a FASTag-based annual toll pass for private car owners on August 15, priced at Rs 3,000. This initiative aims to provide significant cost savings, potentially reducing annual toll expenses by approximately Rs 7,000 for frequent highway users.
title: From I-Day, you can buy FASTag-based Rs 3k annual toll pass for private cars

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid escalating conflict between Israel and Iran, US president Donald Trump remains ambiguous about potential military action against Iran. He stated having “a plan for everything” but offered no specifics, hinting at possible future talks while emphasising Iran's past rejection of a deal. Tehran faces severe consequences with Israeli airstrikes, deserted streets, disrupted services.
title: 'I have plan for everything': Trump doesn’t confirm strike on Iran; but leaves options open

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amidst escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, India has launched Operation Sindhu to evacuate its citizens from Iran. The first flight, carrying 110 Indian citizens, mostly students, landed in New Delhi from Yerevan, Armenia. The Indian Embassy in Tehran facilitated the safe relocation of students from the city.
title: Op Sindhu: First rescue flight carrying 110 Indian students lands in Delhi; evacuated from Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, Vladimir Putin offered Russia's mediation between Iran and Israel, citing Moscow's unique ties. He revealed proposals shared with Iran, Israel, and the U.S. for de-escalation. While Trump dismissed the offer, Putin highlighted Russia's nuclear cooperation with Iran, assuring Israel of security measures.
title: Putin proposes Iran-Israel peace talks; Trump tells him to focus on Ukraine

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The U.S. Army is launching Detachment 201, integrating tech expertise with military innovation. Four Silicon Valley executives, including CTOs from Palantir and Meta, along with leaders from OpenAI and Thinking Machines Lab, have joined the Army Reserve as Lt. Cols. They will advise on tech solutions, contributing around 120 hours annually.
title: Tech meets duty: 4 top Silicon Valley execs join US Army as reserves; here’s what they’ll do

author: TNN
description: Viswashkumar Ramesh, the sole survivor of the Air India 171 plane crash, performed the last rites for his brother Ajay in their ancestral village. Despite his miraculous survival, Viswash is deeply shaken by Ajay's death, having been seated nearby on the ill-fated flight.
title: Air India crash: Lone survivor shoulders brother’s bier; recalls fall from sky

author: TNN
description: Surat police apprehended Kirti Patel, a notorious history-sheeter, after a year-long search in connection with a Rs 2 crore extortion case. Patel, despite being a fugitive, maintained a public presence on Instagram. She and her accomplices allegedly honey-trapped a builder, using compromising photos to extort money. Patel faces multiple FIRs across Gujarat for various offenses, including attempted murder and extortion.
title: Influencer Kirti Patel arrested in Ahmedabad; honey-trapped builder
